titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2799) making appropriations for the Departments of Commerce, Justice, and State, the Judiciary, and related agencies for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2004, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 108-226, by Mr. Linder.

Provides one hour of general debate equally divided and controlled by the chairman and ranking minority member of the Committee on Appropriations. The rule waives all points of order against consideration of the bill. Rule waives points of order against provisions in the bill for failure to comply with clause 2 of rule XXI (prohibiting unauthorized appropriations or legislative provisions in an appropriations bill), except as specified in the resolution. Authorizes the Chair to accord priority in recognition to Members who have pre-printed their amendments in the Congressional Record.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 91.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 326.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 221 - 199 (Roll no. 401).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 7/22/2003--Passed House without amendment. Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R. 2799 (FY 2004 Departments of Commerce, Justice, and State, the Judiciary, and related agencies appropriations).
